ext_description.p: A Component_based_annotation_text_relationship is a type of . A Component_based_annotation_text_relationship is the information that specifies an explicit text message based on the component, where the message content is either the value of the reference to the component's locator or the value of the terminal pin identifier.
ext_description.note: This information permits product data stored in standard exchange files to serve as messages that are presented to the user in the medium of the , such as the text of the locator reference or the terminal pin name. This information is not intended to be populated for general etched characters on the board.

ext_description.p: the message_type specifies either a component locator reference or a terminal locator for the Component_based_annotation_text_relationship. The message_type is a discriminator for determining which data to use from the attribute relating_feature that is inherited from the Application Object . The useful options are either or . Either of these options will require a query based on the attribute assembly_design_requirement of the design which this is helping to define. For the component locator reference option, two additional queries are required, one to determine the and the second to determine the . The component locator reference is the attribute reference_designation of the returned instance of . The string content of that attribute shall be the string content of the message of the related_stratum_concept. For the terminal locator option, additional queries are necessary, continuing with the and terminating at the relevant with an intermediate query of . The string content of the name attribute of shall be the string content of the message of the related_stratum_concept.
ext_description.note: The attribute message_type is not a value of data. It is a declaration of the type of Component_based_annotation_text_relationship.
The data contained in the reference_designation attribute in a member of is an instance of a message of one type.
The data contained in the name attribute in a member of is an instance of a message of the second type.

ext_description.p: the related_stratum_concept redeclares the related_stratum_concept inherited from to be for the Component_based_annotation_text_relationship. There is no explicit geometric relationship defined in this part of ISO 10303 between the design element referenced by the message presented by the related_stratum_concept and the related_stratum_concept itself. Only the related_stratum_concept is positioned in the current design. The component or feature referenced by the message in the attribute related_stratum_concept is defined in a different design that is an .
ext_description.note: This is the actual physical message, as realized by the fabrication process. The position of the corresponding elements in the two designs are usually defined by an end user using a layout tool which presents a view of the data from the assembly in the layout tool for design efficiency.
